tool.name: Phylorelatives
tool.description: Relatedness of minor alelle sequences in NJ tree

repeat.name: sequences
repeat.title: Input FASTA file
repeat.help: Files will be concatenated into a single FASTA multiple alignment file, thus equal length homologous sequences are required

param.name: sequence
param.label: FASTA file
param.help: Requires at least one minor allele sequence properly labeled "_minor" or "_test" e.g. ">sample1_minor"

param.name: root_fa
param.label: Root tree using
param.help: Must have the same length as input sequences

param.name: pairwise
param.label: Use pairwise deletion of gaps/missing data

tool.help:
-----
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Constructs relatedness of a set of sequences based on the pairwise proportion of different sites. One or more test sequences are accepted as long as their name include the strict suffix "_minor" or "_test" (i.e. >seq1_minor). It returns the FASTA multiple alignment used, and reports a table with the closest major allele relatives per minor allele sequence, the tree plot and newick string of the tree.
-----
.. class:: warningmark
**Note**
This tools DOES NOT align the sequences. Consequently, same length homologous sequences are required as input to fabricate a FASTA multiple alignment by concatenation if more than one FASTA file is provided.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**About formats**
*FASTA multiple alignment*
See http://www.bioperl.org/wiki/FASTA_multiple_alignment_format
-----
**Example**
- For the following dataset:: >sample1_major >sample1_minor >sample2_major >sample3_major >sample4_major
- running this tool with *b = 1000* *m = yes* *root = RSRS*, will return:: newick relatives plot
-----
**Citation**
If you use this tool, please cite Dickins B, Rebolledo-Jaramillo B, et al. *In preparation.* (boris-at-bx.psu.edu)
